shortdesc.$: You can rectify minor faults on your appliance yourself. Read the troubleshooting information before contacting after-sales service. This will avoid unnecessary costs.

safety-instruction.$: Repairs to the appliance should only be carried out by trained specialist staff.
Only use genuine spare parts when repairing the appliance.
If the power cord of this appliance is damaged, it must be replaced with a special connection cable, which is available from the manufacturer or his Customer Service.

p.$: Use size 4X30 bolts to adjust the door gap.

title.$: The filters in the water connection of the supply or AquaStop hose are blocked.

link.@source: The filters in the water connection of the supply or AquaStop hose are blocked.

p.$: Switch off the appliance.
Pull out the mains plug.
Turn off the water tap.
Unscrew the water connection.
Remove the filter from the supply hose
Clean the filter.
Re-insert the filter in the supply hose.
Screw the water connection back on.
Check the water connection for leaks.
Restore the power supply.
Switch the appliance on.
Clean the filters.

link.@source: A different error code appears in the display window.
A different error code appears in the display window.

p.$: Unplug the appliance or switch off the fuse.
Wait at least 2 minutes.
Insert the mains plug of the appliance in a socket or switch on the fuse.
Switch the appliance on.
If the problem occurs again:

link.@target: Appliance interior still wet after wash cycle.
Wipeable or water-soluble coatings are present inside the appliance or on the door.

Tea residue or lipstick marks on tableware.

Plastic parts inside the appliance are discoloured.
Removable streaks are present on glasses, glassware with a metallic appearance and cutlery.
Detergent residue is present in the detergent dispenser or the tablet collecting tray.
No rinse aid used or dosage set too low.
Programme or programme option has no drying phase, or the drying phase is too brief.
Water collects in recesses of the tableware or cutlery.
The combined detergent used has a poor drying performance.
Extra Dry not activated to improve drying performance.
Tableware removed too early or drying process not yet ended.
Rinse aid used has a limited drying performance.

title.$: Extra Dry not activated to improve drying performance.

title.$: Tableware removed too early or drying process not yet ended.

title.$: Rinse aid used has a limited drying performance.

title.$: Appliance interior still wet after wash cycle.

link.@target: Not a fault. The condensation drying principle causes water droplets in the tub – they are indeed desirable here. The moisture in the air condenses on the inside walls, runs off and is pumped out.
link.@source: Appliance interior still wet after wash cycle.

p.$: Use dishwasher-proof glasses.
Glasses are usually only suitable for use in a dishwasher, i.e. long-term wear or long-term changes must be expected.
Avoid a lengthy steam phase (standing time after wash cycle ends).
Use a programme with a lower temperature.
Set the softening system to the water hardness.
Use detergent with a glass protection component.

Connect the appliance to the power supply.
Switch the appliance on.

title.$: Light items of tableware move about during the wash cycle.

p.$: Position light items of tableware securely.

shortdesc.$: Large remnants of food or foreign bodies can block the waste water pump. As soon as the rinsing water no longer drains properly, the waste water pump must be cleaned.

cause.$: Sharp and pointed objects or fragments of glass may block the waste water pump and cause injury.

p.$: Disconnect the appliance from the power supply.
Remove the top and bottom basket.
Remove the filter system.
Scoop out any water.
Use a sponge if necessary.
Prise off the pump cover using a spoon and grip it by the crosspiece.
Lift the pump cover inwards at an angle and remove.
Remove any remnants of food and foreign bodies in the area of the impeller.
The pump cover clicks into position.
Install the filter system.
Insert the top and bottom basket.
